author: Staff Reporter
text: The International Fishermen Development Trust (INFIDET) has appealed to the union government to take proactive steps through diplomatic channels to bring back the body of Kanyakumari fisherman Ignasi Xavier, which was found at Qateef Harbour in Saudi Arabia on February 5 and kept at the Government Hospital in Qatif. It was alleged that he went for fishing on January 25. When others returned to the shore, Ignasi Xavier was found missing. The relatives of the deceased are finding it difficult to complete the formalities to bring back the body to India, said a release from P. Justin Antony, President, INFIDET.
title: Plea for help to bring body of fisherman from Saudi Arabia
